command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the image version from where the session host is started from.
The function will help you getting insights if there are session hosts started from an old version in relation to the Shared Image Gallery
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
This is a switch parameter which let you control the output to show only the sessionhosts which are not started from the latest version.
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
This is a switch parameter which let you control the output to show only the sessionhosts which are not started from the latest version.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-WvdImageVersionStatus -WvdHostpoolName wvd-hostpool -ResourceGroupName wvd-resourcegroup Get-AzWvdHostpool -WvdHostpoolName wvd-hostpool -ResourceGroupName wvd-resourcegroup | Get-WvdImageVersionStatus

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the latest session host from the WVD Hostpool
The function will help you getting the latests session host from a WVD Hostpool. By running this function you will able to define the next number for deploying new session hosts.
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
You can put the hostpool object in here.
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
You can put the hostpool object in here.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-AzWvdHostpool -WvdHostpoolName wvd-hostpool -ResourceGroupName wvd-resourcegroup | Get-WvdLatestSessionHost Get-WvdLatestSessionHost -WvdHostpoolName wvd-hostpool -ResourceGroupName wvd-resourcegroup

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the connected Network Security Group based on the WVD subnet
The function will help you getting the connected Network Security Group, based on the latest sessionhost. The function will return the NSG object from where you are able to add rules.
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-WvdSubnet -WvdHostpoolName wvd-hostpool -ResourceGroupName wvd-resourcegroup Add a comment to existing incidnet

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Virtual Machines Azure resource from a WVD Session Host
The function will help you getting the virtual machine resource information which is behind the WVD Session Host

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-WvdSessionHostResources -SessionHost SessionHostObject Add a comment to existing incidnet

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the connected subnet to the given WVD Hostpool name
The function will help you getting the connected subnet which are the session hosts are using. Based on the latest sessionhost.
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-WvdSubnet -WvdHostpoolName wvd-hostpool -ResourceGroupName wvd-resourcegroup Add a comment to existing incidnet

maml:description.maml:para: Will create a new registration token which you need to onboard new session hosts
The function will create a new registration token, if needed, and will return the value which you need to onboard new session hosts
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Optional, give the token availability in hours. Default 4.
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Optional, give the token availability in hours. Default 4.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-WvdRegistrationToken -WvdHostpoolName wvd-hostpool -ResourceGroupName wvd-resourcegroup Add a comment to existing incidnet

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Virtual Machines Azure resource from a WVD Session Host
The function will help you getting the virtual machine resource information which is behind the WVD Session Host

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-WvdVmResource -SessionHost SessionHostObject Add a comment to existing incidnet

maml:description.maml:para: Updates sessionhosts for accepting or denying connections.
The function will update sessionhosts drainmode to true or false. This can be one sessionhost or all of them.
An sessionhost object or array of sessionhosts.
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
An sessionhost object or array of sessionhosts.
Enter the WVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
